parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural

str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A disease, malady, sickness. Of uncertain affinity; a malady.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To disturb, cause tumult, trouble, annoy. From en and ochleo; to crowd in, i.e. to annoy.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
